imdb.title: All Out
imdb.plot: Kenji Gion joins the rugby club with his classmate, Iwashimizu, who has a complicated past and sub-captain Hachiouji, who always takes good care of his Club members. Lastly, there is Captain Sekizan, who has overwhelming powers.

episodes.title: This Year's First-Years are Hilarious
episodes.plot: Gion and Iwashimizu join the Jinko rugby team. Captain Sekizan Takuya imposes a brutal training exercise known as "the turtle" on Gion, who wants to practice tackling. Will Gion be able to successfully tackle the large Sekizan?!

episodes.title: I Want to Tackle Someone
episodes.plot: Gion and Iwashimizu join the Jinko rugby team. Captain Sekizan Takuya imposes a brutal training exercise known as "the turtle" on Gion, who wants to practice tackling. Will Gion be able to successfully tackle the large Sekizan?!

episodes.title: What's Most Important
episodes.plot: The practice game against Keijo High, one of Kanagawa's top four teams, begins. Iwashizumi faces off against Miyuki Atsushi, the friend he injured during middle school.

episodes.title: What Should I Do?
episodes.plot: The match takes a turn for the worse under their opponents' skillfull assault. In order to change the flow of the game, Sekizan subs in the amateur Gion! Will Gion have a chance to shine in his very first match? Jinko VS Keijo finally comes to a close!!

episodes.title: What's Lacking
episodes.plot: The Jinko rugby club's training camp has begun. As the team engages in intense practice, a lone man appears and tells them they're wasting their time. The harsh words of former national team coach Komori Shingo leave the team at a loss.

episodes.title: Giving Everything You've Got
episodes.plot: The first thing the hot-tempered sore loser Ebumi ever became passionate about... was rugby. And because of his attitude, he can't tolerate the lukewarm approach of his teammates!

episodes.title: I Want to Be Able to Do Everything
episodes.plot: For Gion, who joined the rugby team after being charmed by tackling, rugby = tackling. Even during an intrasquad match, Gion neglects teamwork and the basics in favor of tackling and tackling and tackling... Komori has some harsh words for Gion!

episodes.title: Ball Games
episodes.plot: As the members of the rugby team are feeling the results of their training camp, Komori arranges a practice match against Todo-dai Sagami.

episodes.title: You've Gotten Stronger
episodes.plot: Second place school Todo-dai Sagami continues to impress... Not only are they strong, but their clever play produces advantageous situations for them throughout the game.

episodes.title: I Ate Too Much Shaved Ice
episodes.plot: With their game against Todo-dai Sagami over, the Jinko rugby team has even more work to do. At Komori's suggestion, they engage in an unusual practice session on the beach! Gion begins to wonder if there's a better position for him on the team...

episodes.title: You Have No Feel for the Game
episodes.plot: Gion and Kamo have arrived at Ryoin Academy to spy on the team. Gion's path has become clear to him, while Kamo is overwhelmed by the amazing prowess of Ryoin.

episodes.title: Joint Practice
episodes.plot: Since meeting Sekito, Gion has begun to see his own path. In order to become a flanker, he chooses to particiate in the fowards' practice. Gion is inspired by the hard work of the forwards of one of the best teams in Kangawa.

episodes.title: Let's Go to Ryogoku Together
episodes.plot: Though Gion has decided to be a flanker, he doesn't know what to practice. While watching Iwashimizu offer advice, Hachioji is reminded of Sekizan's past; the unknown story of how Sekizan, who now leads the Jinko rugby team, joined the team is revealed!

episodes.title: X Day
episodes.plot: Komori meets with his former college teammate Tomie Yujiro. Time flies as they have fun catching each other up on how they've been doing.

episodes.title: Teammate
episodes.plot: Encouraged by Komori and his friends, Sekizan begins practicing even harder. Though everything appears to be going well for Jinko, X Day isn't over yet... Will another team member be leaving the Jinko rugby club?!

episodes.title: You've Prepared
episodes.plot: With the Sugadaira training camp starting tomorrow, Sekizan and Hachioji take their brief day off to go out together. In contrast with Umeno and Rie's wild fantasies, the two of them are simply going to a lunch meeting at Coach Komori's house.

episodes.title: Summer Training Camp
episodes.plot: The summer training camp has finally begun!! Strong players from all over the country have gathered at Sugadaira, and every day several practice matches are conducted on the various fields.

episodes.title: I'm Not Crying
episodes.plot: After some harsh words, the Tenjiku team's stagnant atmosphere begins to change. They begin closing the point gap between themselves and Jinko. In order to change the flow of the game, Jinko sends Oharano onto the field.

episodes.title: Aren't You Happy?
episodes.plot: The whistle sounds and the curtains close on a fierce battle. In their fight against Tenjiku, Jinko has achieved victory. At dinner after the game, Jinko finds themselves unable to celebrate their victory.

episodes.title: Good Luck Charm
episodes.plot: After their match, Gion and his teammates run into a group of Ryoin players at a crepe shope. Yoshida's request pays off, and Ryoin agrees to play against Jinko in two days.

episodes.title: Your Turf
episodes.plot: With the Ryoin match coming up, the stagnating Gion practices tackling with Kasuga, Hyosu, and Ise!

episodes.title: My Friend Taught Me
episodes.plot: Iwashimizu is anxious about the match against Ryoin. Miyuki realizes his friend's emotional state and shows up at his inn. When Gion, who had been training at the field alone, joins them, the three of them begin a secret training session!

episodes.title: The Opponent We Never Could've Fought
episodes.plot: The team's game against Ryoin has finally started!! They may be the second string, but Ryoin is still the strongest team in Kanagawa!

episodes.title: All Out
episodes.plot: The Jinko versus Ryoin game heads towards is magnificent conclusion!
